Articles.Content: I've been out of KSP for a while, but I have been really hankering to get back.  I went to round up some mods and saw that the dreaded version changes were wrecking their normal havoc on the modding community.  I've poked around a bit, and I think all the mods I really want are more or less update to date, except for one., MechJeb.  I don't find flying my ship with arrow keys fun.  I don't like stretching around nav points and eyeballing stuff.  I like telling the ship to circularize the orbit 3 hours from now, or at 100,000 km and being done with it.   When I'm in orbit, I want to be able to tell the ship to just plot best intercept course the the space station, and I am totally cool with the computer docking to the station while it is at it.  I don't want to eyeball my suicide burn, or calculate it out ahead of time.  I don't need to press space bar to do the staging, it's okay if the ship just does its own gravity turn.  I love MechJeb for taking care of all that.  Is there any alternative to MechJeb that takes care of those things so I can focus on stuff I like about KSP?  Or should I just roll back?

I do not like them in a house.
I do not like them with a mouse.
I do not like them here or there.
I do not like them anywhere.
I do not like green eggs and ham.
I do not like them, Sam-I-Am.

...sorry...couldn't help myself
